Column Comment.0: SUBSTANCE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a substance that can be describedeither chemically or in terms of composition. Elements, ions, isotopes, isomers,minerals, chemicals, solvents, production substances, hydrocarbons etc are all listed.Be advised that many applications and agencies may use the same term, but thedefinition and composition details may not be the same. Use the SUBSTANCE XREFtable to capture relationships between substances, such as similar substances.
Column Comment.1: SUB SUBSTANCE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a substance that is acomponent of the SUBSTANCE ID.
Column Comment.2: COMPOSITION OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifier for the relationshipbetween the substance and its composite parts.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: DEFINED BY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ID: The unique identifier for the businessassociate who defined this substance composition.
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.7: FORMULA: The formula that is used to calculate the derivation of the sub substancefrom the substance.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.9: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.10: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.11: SOURCE DOCUMENT: unique identifier for the document. For example governmentand regulatory agency forms, operator reports or scout tickets, publications,reference books etc.
Column Comment.12: SUBSTANCE COMPONENT TYPE: the type of relationship between the substanceand its composite parts. For example, a sub-substance might be a chemical fractionof the parent, or a product that is created duing processing.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
